Utterance: Hi, it's Ellie again. I'm glad to see you back today. How have you been since our last session?
I've been doing pretty well, thanks.
That's great to hear! Last time, you mentioned feeling a lot better since you started going to church. Have you continued with that?
Yeah, I've been going regularly. It really helps me feel grounded.
I'm glad to hear that. What do you enjoy most about going to church?
I like the sense of community and the messages. They give me hope and encouragement.
That sounds wonderful. Have you made any new connections there?
A few, yeah. I’ve met some nice people who share similar values.
That's fantastic! Building connections can be really beneficial. How do you feel about those new friendships?
I feel good about them. It's nice to be around people who understand what I'm going through.
That’s important. You mentioned last time that you enjoy cooking. Have you had a chance to experiment with any new recipes?
Actually, yes! I tried making a new dish for my family last week.
What did you make?
I made a homemade lasagna. It turned out pretty good!
That sounds delicious! How did it feel to cook for your family?
It felt great. I love seeing them enjoy what I cook.
Cooking can be such a nurturing act. Do you find it relaxing as well?
Definitely. It’s like therapy for me.
That’s a wonderful outlet! Have you thought about incorporating cooking into your routine more, maybe as a way to unwind?
Yeah, I think I will. It helps me focus and forget about other worries.
That’s a great strategy. You also mentioned feeling anxious about the world and your children’s future. How has that been for you lately?
It still weighs on my mind sometimes, but I’m trying to stay positive.
That’s understandable. It’s a tough world out there. Have you found any techniques that help you manage those feelings?
I try to pray and meditate when I feel overwhelmed.
Those are excellent coping strategies. How has that worked for you?
It helps me calm down and focus on the present.
That’s wonderful. Mindfulness can be very powerful. Have you considered incorporating mindfulness exercises into your daily routine?
I haven’t really thought about it, but I’m open to it.
Perhaps we could explore some mindfulness practices together next time. Would you be interested in that?
Yeah, that sounds good.
Great! Is there anything specific you’d like to work on in our sessions moving forward?
I guess just finding ways to manage stress better.
That’s a good goal. We can definitely focus on that. I’d also like to explore your feelings about parenting a bit more. How do you feel about your role as a father?
I feel proud, but sometimes I worry if I’m doing enough.
It’s natural to have those concerns. What do you think makes a good parent?
I think being there for your kids and teaching them right from wrong is important.
Absolutely. You seem to have a strong sense of responsibility. Do you feel supported in your parenting journey?
Sometimes, but I think I could use more help.
What kind of support do you think would be helpful?
Maybe just talking to other parents or finding a group to join.
That sounds like a great idea! Connecting with other parents can provide valuable insights and support.
Yeah, I think it would help me feel less alone in it.
Definitely. We can look into resources for that as well. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
No, I think that covers it for now.
Alright, thank you for sharing today. I’m looking forward to our next session and exploring mindfulness techniques together.
Me too! Thanks, Ellie.
You’re welcome! Take care, and see you next time.
Bye!
